snippet: As the Senate minority leader, Mitch McConnell has been a constant foil to the president’s agenda. Now he’s expected to be the majority leader. Can two political combatants function together without driving each other crazy?
abstract: Political Memo; relationship between expected Republican Senate majority leader Mitch McConnell and President Obama could determine Obama's legislative legacy and Republican presidential fortunes in 2016; they have had six years of sparse communication and social interaction but frequent open hostility.
lead_paragraph: As the Senate minority leader, Mitch McConnell has been a constant foil to the president’s agenda. Now he’s expected to be the majority leader. Can two political combatants function together without driving each other crazy?

headline.main: G.O.P. Leader’s New Role Could Take Strained White House Ties to Next Level
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Leader’s New Role Could Take Strained White House Ties to Next Level
